content_text: Forces are interactions that cause changes in motion. They are vectors having both magnitude and direction.
Resistance of any physical object to any change in its velocity.
A push or pull upon an object resulting from interaction with another object.
Students believe a constant force is needed to keep an object moving at constant speed.
explanation: Newton's 1st Law: An object in motion stays in motion unless acted upon by a net force.
correction: Friction is usually the force that stops objects; in a vacuum
order_index: no force is needed to maintain constant velocity.

content_text: Seatbelts protect passengers from the effects of inertia during sudden stops.
